org.eclipse.mylyn.wikitext.html.core
Class HtmlLanguageBuilder

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.mylyn.wikitext.html.core.HtmlLanguageBuilder

public class HtmlLanguageBuilder
extends java.lang.Object

Provides a way to build HTML languages that support a specific set of HTML tags.

Since:
2.0
Author:
david.green
See Also:
HtmlLanguage.builder()

Method Detail

name

public HtmlLanguageBuilder name(java.lang.String name)
Sets the name of the markup language.

Parameters:
name - the name
Returns:
this builder

add

public HtmlLanguageBuilder add(DocumentBuilder.BlockType blockType)
Adds the given DocumentBuilder.BlockType to the supported syntax of the language created by this builder.

Adding DocumentBuilder.BlockType.TABLE, DocumentBuilder.BlockType.BULLETED_LIST, DocumentBuilder.BlockType.NUMERIC_LIST or DocumentBuilder.BlockType.DEFINITION_LIST will cause the corresponding related blocks to be added. For example, adding DocumentBuilder.BlockType.BULLETED_LIST also adds DocumentBuilder.BlockType.LIST_ITEM.

Parameters:
blockType - the block type
Returns:
this builder

add

public HtmlLanguageBuilder add(DocumentBuilder.SpanType spanType)
Adds the given DocumentBuilder.SpanType to the supported syntax of the language created by this builder.

Parameters:
spanType - the span type
Returns:
this builder

addHeadings

public HtmlLanguageBuilder addHeadings(int level)
Adds support for headings up to and including the specified level.

Parameters:
level - the level which must be a number between 1 and 6 inclusive
Returns:
this builder

addSpanFont

public HtmlLanguageBuilder addSpanFont()
Adds support for the <font> HTML tag as a DocumentBuilder.SpanType.SPAN. The resulting document builder will convert DocumentBuilder.SpanType.SPAN with size or colour CSS rules to <font> when generating HTML.

Returns:

setXhtmlStrict

public HtmlLanguageBuilder setXhtmlStrict(boolean xhtmlStrict)
Indicate if the resulting document builder should attempt to conform to strict XHTML rules. The default is false.

Parameters:
xhtmlStrict - true if the language should attempt to conform to XHTML strict rules, otherwise false
Returns:
this builder
Since:
2.2

document

public HtmlLanguageBuilder document(java.lang.String prefix,
                                    java.lang.String suffix)
Provides a prefix and suffix which are emitted as literals at the start and end of content created using the document builder.

Parameters:
prefix - the prefix which is an HTML literal value that precedes the content, for example "<div>" or "<html><body>". May be empty.
suffix - the prefix which is an HTML literal value that precedes the content, for example "</div>" or "</body></html>". May be empty.
Returns:
this builder
See Also:
HtmlDocumentHandler

create

public HtmlLanguage create()
